result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan A. Kivi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nathan A. Kivi is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nathan A. Kivi was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Nathan A. Kivi was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Counts 3 & 4 are concurrent and also concurrent w/ 12CF257.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan A. Kivi

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Revoked KCJ on 4/27/17

State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne. DE appears in custody with Atty Ted Kmiec.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  1007 - Parties are prepared to proceed.   Victim rights compliance.  Sentence recommendations.  Ct3:  Defendant is sentenced to 9 months in the Kenosha County Jail with huber for employment only.  Credit for 151 days. Ct4:  Defendant is sentenced to 90 days in the Kenosha County Jail consecutive to Ct3 with huber for employment only. NO WORK CREW. No new costs ordered. Any outstanding costs remaining may be converted to civil judgment. Appeal rights given.
Court reporter transcript invoice for 030416 plea/sentencing paid by county $22.50
3/4/16 - Plea Hearing
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 27, 2017 at 10:00 am.
To linked case #15TR5930.
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty Ted Kmiec.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES: 1120 - Matter heard with trailing TR files. Court vacates the issuance of any warrant. Case is resolved. DE enters plea of guilty as to Cts 3, 4 - found guilty by the court. Cts 1,2 dismissed outright. Sentence recommendations made. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 1 year w/conditions on each count concurrent to each other and to 12CF257. Defendant ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay $200 DNA surcharge on each count and notice was given. Court costs ordered.  No restitution requested. Costs to be paid from bond on deposit, any left over may be returned to the poster. Appeal rights given.
Atty Kmiec is unavailable for VA next week. Per Judge, stay of BWAR is extended to 3/4. VA scheduled for 3/4/16 @ 11am. DE, Atty Kmiec notified in person, ADA notified by email.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State/County. DE appears by Atty Ted Kmiec. No appearance by DE.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES: 1049 -   Victim rights compliance. Atty Kmiec has no explanation for DE's non-appearance. Resolution has been reached. ST requests BWAR be ordered and stayed - granted. BWAR authorized with $500 bond - stayed until 2/25/16 at 12:00pm. Forfeiture of all bonds also stayed.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty Ted Kmiec.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES: 1116 -   Victim rights compliance. Matter heard with 15TR5930, 5931, 5932. Matter has resolved.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Per Renee @ Atty Kmiec's office - FPT adjourned due to scheduling conflict to 1/7/16 @ 9am. All parties confirmed by e-mail.
FPT set for today is adj. to 12/9/15 at 9:30 at request of parties.  Parties are exchanging discovery and negotiating a settlement of all files.
$1000 deposited on 9/25/15

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No violent contact w/ Katie T.
940.235(1) -Strangulation & Suffocation, DV, Repeater   940.19(1) -Battery, DV, Repeater   943.01(1) -Criminal Damage to Property, Repeater   947.01(1) -DC/DV, Repeater

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Theodore Kmiec.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:58am-  Victim rights compliance.  Bond motion filed by Attorney Kmiec.  Judge Wilk discloses that he is a member of the Wilmot Mountain Ski Patrol, where the DE is employed.  Neither party requests recusal.  Arguments heard.  Court modifies bond to $1,000.00 cash bond.  Bond conditions modified to allow non-violent contact w/ Katie T.  Final pre-trial adjourned to October 29, 2015 at 02:00 pm.  Bond continued.
to Modify Bond - filed by Attorney Theodore Kmiec
filed by Attorney Theodore Kmiec     (9/17/2015 at 10:30am)

of Judge Schroeder filed by def.
to Preliminary Hearing

Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Theodore Kmiec.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found.  Bound over to Br. 3.  Request for substitution of Judge Schroeder filed by def.; tab pulled and case reassigned to Judge S. Michael Wilk.  Information filed; plea of not guilty entered.  FPT 9/17/15 at 10:30.  Bond continued.

1pm  Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Ted Kmiec.  Clerk: NJurgens.  Preliminary Hearing set on 8/14/15 @ 945am before Comm Mason, 927-54th Street, Room 157, Kenosha, WI.  15TR5930 thru 15TR5932 to trail.  Bond continued.  kmk

2:05 pm    Special Prosecutor K. Richard Wells appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk:  NJ.  Deft will retain his own counsel.    Initial appearance adjourned to 8-9-15 @ 1:00pm w/Comm Mason, 927-54th Street, Rm 157, Kenosha, WI.  Temporary $10,000 cash bond set with conditions.  DE requesting adjournment as he has retained Atty Kmiec.
